# Instructions

Reverse a string

For example:
input: "cool"
output: "looc"

####

Use the above instructions to modify the supplied files: reverse_string.py
Keep and implement the existing function or class stubs, they will be called from unit tests.
Do not implement or change any unit tests.
Only use standard python libraries, don't suggest installing any packages.

Solution:
We can simply iterate over the input string using a loop and concatenate the characters in reverse order to get the reversed string.

Here's how we can do this:

items.content:
def reverse(text):
    # Initialize empty string to store the reversed text
    rev_str = ""

    # Iterate over the input string backwards and append each character to the output string
    for char in text[::-1]:
        rev_str += char

    # Return the reversed string
    return rev_str

items.text: This solution has O(n) time complexity where n is the length of the input string since we need to iterate over every character once. We can also achieve the same functionality using slicing but it would require creating a new string which may not be efficient for large strings. Hence, iterating over the string is preferred.
